buildingblocks.name: Growth in New Users
buildingblocks.summary: Growing the number of new API users is pretty obvious. That is what we all want. But it needs to be listed on your API evangelism strategy so you think about it constantly, ask it regularly and constantly innovate how you will attract new developers. nNew developers will come from all areas of your API evangelism efforts. There will be many different ways to get developers in the door, but only so
buildingblocks.details: Growing the number of new API users is pretty obvious. That is what we all want. But it needs to be listed on your API evangelism strategy so you think about it constantly, ask it regularly and constantly innovate how you will attract new developers. nNew developers will come from all areas of your API evangelism efforts. There will be many different ways to get developers in the door, but only some will convince them to continue to use your API. nNew developers are often the leading KPI for new API efforts.  While new developers are the life blood your API evangelism efforts, it shouldn't blind you from establishing other KPIs, that are more meaningful to your success. nk

buildingblocks.name: Growth in Existing User API Usage
buildingblocks.category: Growth in Existing User API Usage

buildingblocks.name: Brand Awareness
buildingblocks.summary: nOne of the top reasons for designing, deploying and managing an active APIs is increase awareness of your brand. nWhen first hearing about APIs many companies first concern is regarding control over their brand--feeling they might lose control over their brand in a programmatic world. nWith the right brand strategy for your API, you can effectively use your API to actually increase brand awarenes
buildingblocks.details: nOne of the top reasons for designing, deploying and managing an active APIs is increase awareness of your brand. nWhen first hearing about APIs many companies first concern is regarding control over their brand--feeling they might lose control over their brand in a programmatic world. nWith the right brand strategy for your API, you can effectively use your API to actually increase brand awareness and not hurt it. nWhile evangelizing your API, think of how you can effectively package your brand to be part of your developers experience in a non-intrusive way.nYour brand needs to be ubiquitous across your evangelism efforts, in addition to being an essential part of your API developer portal community--properly guiding your developers in alignment with your overall brand marketing.

buildingblocks.name: Fresh Engagement
buildingblocks.summary: Emailing new developers who have registered weekly to see what their immediate needs are, while their registration is fresh in their minds.
buildingblocks.details: Emailing new developers who have registered weekly to see what their immediate needs are, while their registration is fresh in their minds.

buildingblocks.name: Active User Engagement
buildingblocks.summary: Where we reach out to existing, active users of your API and find out what they need. We profile them, including Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and pull any profile information. Grade and categorize each developer.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Where we reach out to existing, active users of your API and find out what they need. We profile them, including Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and pull any profile information. Grade and categorize each developer.nnn

buildingblocks.name: Historical Engagement
buildingblocks.summary: Emailing historical active and / or inactive developers to engage and understand what their needs are and would make them active or increase activity.
buildingblocks.details: Emailing historical active and / or inactive developers to engage and understand what their needs are and would make them active or increase activity.

buildingblocks.name: Social Engagement
buildingblocks.summary: When emailing any developer, using Rapportive we establish any URL, Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn profile they have and reach out via these networks.
buildingblocks.details: When emailing any developer, using Rapportive we establish any URL, Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn profile they have and reach out via these networks.

buildingblocks.name: Projects
buildingblocks.summary: Establishing of editorial assembly line of technical projects that can feed blog stories, how-tos, samples and Github libraries.
buildingblocks.details: Establishing of editorial assembly line of technical projects that can feed blog stories, how-tos, samples and Github libraries.

buildingblocks.name: Stories
buildingblocks.summary: Writing, editing and posting of stories derived from projects, with SEO and API area support by design.
buildingblocks.details: Writing, editing and posting of stories derived from projects, with SEO and API area support by design.

buildingblocks.name: Syndication
buildingblocks.summary: Syndication to Tumblr, Blogger and other relevant blogging sites.
buildingblocks.details: Syndication to Tumblr, Blogger and other relevant blogging sites.

buildingblocks.name: Competition Monitoring
buildingblocks.summary: Evaluation of regular activity of competitors.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Evaluation of regular activity of competitors.nnn

buildingblocks.name: Industry Monitoring
buildingblocks.summary: Evaluation of relevant topics and trends of overall industry.
buildingblocks.details: Evaluation of relevant topics and trends of overall industry.

buildingblocks.name: Project & Developer Sites
buildingblocks.summary: Identifying of relevant project sites like Elance and ODesk, and targeting developers who may be suited for engagement.
buildingblocks.details: Identifying of relevant project sites like Elance and ODesk, and targeting developers who may be suited for engagement.

buildingblocks.name: Keywords
buildingblocks.summary: Established a list of keywords to use when searching for topics at search engines, QA, forums, social bookmarking and social networks.
buildingblocks.details: Established a list of keywords to use when searching for topics at search engines, QA, forums, social bookmarking and social networks.

buildingblocks.name: City Targeting
buildingblocks.summary: Target specific markets in cities that make sense to your evangelism strategy.
buildingblocks.details: Target specific markets in cities that make sense to your evangelism strategy.

buildingblocks.name: Formal Studies
buildingblocks.summary: Conduct formal studies in the sector you are targeting, and potentially new business sectors--share internally or possibly with partners and the public.
buildingblocks.details: Conduct formal studies in the sector you are targeting, and potentially new business sectors--share internally or possibly with partners and the public.

buildingblocks.name: Forum Conversations
buildingblocks.summary: Responding to forum activity in a timely and engaging way.
buildingblocks.details: Responding to forum activity in a timely and engaging way.

buildingblocks.name: Forum Posting
buildingblocks.summary: Generating forum activity by anonymous posters or officially with common problems and questions faced throughout community as well as open landscape.
buildingblocks.details: Generating forum activity by anonymous posters or officially with common problems and questions faced throughout community as well as open landscape.

buildingblocks.name: Email Coordination
buildingblocks.summary: Regular coordination, relaying of support issues with central [Client Name] support.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Regular coordination, relaying of support issues with central [Client Name] support.nnn

buildingblocks.name: Email Needs Tracking
buildingblocks.summary: Deriving of common support requests to drive API and API area roadmap.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Deriving of common support requests to drive API and API area roadmap.nnn

buildingblocks.name: Github Repository
buildingblocks.summary: Managing of code sample Gists, official code libraries and any samples, starter kits or other code samples generated through projects.
buildingblocks.details: Managing of code sample Gists, official code libraries and any samples, starter kits or other code samples generated through projects.

buildingblocks.name: Github Relationship
buildingblocks.summary: Managing of followers, forks, downloads and other potential relationships via Github.
buildingblocks.details: Managing of followers, forks, downloads and other potential relationships via Github.

buildingblocks.name: QA Profile Maintenance
buildingblocks.summary: Ensure that profile on Quora and Stack Overflow are active.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Ensure that profile on Quora and Stack Overflow are active.nnn

buildingblocks.name: Stack Exchange
buildingblocks.summary: Regular trolling of Stack Exchange / Stack Overflow and responding to relevant [Client Name] or industry related questions.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Regular trolling of Stack Exchange / Stack Overflow and responding to relevant [Client Name] or industry related questions.nnn

buildingblocks.name: Quora
buildingblocks.summary: Regular trolling of Quora and responding to relevant [Client Name] or industry related questions.
buildingblocks.details: Regular trolling of Quora and responding to relevant [Client Name] or industry related questions.

buildingblocks.name: QA Seeding
buildingblocks.summary: Seeding of questions by anonymous 3rd party profiles for relevant topics.
buildingblocks.details: Seeding of questions by anonymous 3rd party profiles for relevant topics.

buildingblocks.name: LinkedIn
buildingblocks.summary: Setup of new API specific LinkedIn profile page who will follow developers and other relevant users for engagement. Posting of all API evangelism activities.
buildingblocks.details: Setup of new API specific LinkedIn profile page who will follow developers and other relevant users for engagement. Posting of all API evangelism activities.

buildingblocks.name: Google Plus
buildingblocks.summary: Setup of new API specific Google+ company. Posting of all API evangelism activities and management of friends.
buildingblocks.details: Setup of new API specific Google+ company. Posting of all API evangelism activities and management of friends.

buildingblocks.name: Hacker News
buildingblocks.summary: Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to Hacker News, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.
buildingblocks.details: Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to Hacker News, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.

buildingblocks.name: StumbleUpon
buildingblocks.summary: Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to StumbleUpon, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.
buildingblocks.details: Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to StumbleUpon, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.

buildingblocks.name: Reddit
buildingblocks.summary: Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to Reddit, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.
buildingblocks.details: Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to Reddit, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.

buildingblocks.name: Roadmap
buildingblocks.summary: Provide regular roadmap feedback based upon developer outreach and feedback.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Provide regular roadmap feedback based upon developer outreach and feedback.nnn

buildingblocks.name: Activity By Group
buildingblocks.summary: Summary and highlights from weekly activity within the each area of API evangelism strategy.nnn
buildingblocks.details: Summary and highlights from weekly activity within the each area of API evangelism strategy.nnn

buildingblocks.name: New Registrations
buildingblocks.summary: Historical and weekly accounting of new developer registrations across APis.
buildingblocks.details: Historical and weekly accounting of new developer registrations across APis.

buildingblocks.name: Volume of Calls
buildingblocks.summary: Historical and weekly accounting of API calls per API.
buildingblocks.details: Historical and weekly accounting of API calls per API.

buildingblocks.name: Hackathons
buildingblocks.summary: What hackathons are coming up in 30, 90, 120 days? Which would should be sponsored, attended, etc.
buildingblocks.details: What hackathons are coming up in 30, 90, 120 days? Which would should be sponsored, attended, etc.

buildingblocks.name: Meetups
buildingblocks.summary: What are the best meetups in target cities? Are there different formats that would best meet our goals? Are there any sponsorship or speaking opportunities?
buildingblocks.details: What are the best meetups in target cities? Are there different formats that would best meet our goals? Are there any sponsorship or speaking opportunities?

buildingblocks.name: Conferences
buildingblocks.summary: What are the top conferences occurring that we can participate in or attend--pay attention to call for papers of relevant industry events.
buildingblocks.details: What are the top conferences occurring that we can participate in or attend--pay attention to call for papers of relevant industry events.

buildingblocks.name: Storytelling
buildingblocks.summary: Telling stories of an API isn’t just something you do externally, what stores need to be told internally to make sure an API initiative is successful.
buildingblocks.details: Telling stories of an API isn’t just something you do externally, what stores need to be told internally to make sure an API initiative is successful.

buildingblocks.name: Participation
buildingblocks.summary: It is very healthy to include other people from across the company in API operations. How can we include people from other teams in API evangelism efforts.
buildingblocks.details: It is very healthy to include other people from across the company in API operations. How can we include people from other teams in API evangelism efforts.

buildingblocks.name: Reporting
buildingblocks.summary: Sometimes providing regular numbers and reports to key players internally can help keep operations running smooth. What reports can we produce?
buildingblocks.details: Sometimes providing regular numbers and reports to key players internally can help keep operations running smooth. What reports can we produce?

buildingblocks.name: Getting Started
buildingblocks.summary: Evolution of getting started page when relevant based upon API and network changes, and relevant developer feedback.
buildingblocks.details: Evolution of getting started page when relevant based upon API and network changes, and relevant developer feedback.

buildingblocks.name: Documentation
buildingblocks.summary: Enhancement and addition to API documentation based upon project development and active developer engagement and feedback
buildingblocks.details: Enhancement and addition to API documentation based upon project development and active developer engagement and feedback

buildingblocks.name: Code Samples
buildingblocks.summary: Establish new code samples that can be used within API documentation pages, maintain them as API evolves.
buildingblocks.details: Establish new code samples that can be used within API documentation pages, maintain them as API evolves.

buildingblocks.name: Twitter
buildingblocks.summary: Setup of new API specific Twitter account. Tweeting of all API evangelism activity, relevant industry landscape activity, discover new followers and engage with followers.
buildingblocks.details: Setup of new API specific Twitter account. Tweeting of all API evangelism activity, relevant industry landscape activity, discover new followers and engage with followers.

buildingblocks.name: Facebook
buildingblocks.summary: Setup of new API specific Facebook company. Posting of all API evangelism activities and management of friends.
buildingblocks.details: Setup of new API specific Facebook company. Posting of all API evangelism activities and management of friends.

buildingblocks.name: Stories
buildingblocks.summary: Deriving of stories for blog derived from forum activity, and the actual needs of developers.
buildingblocks.details: Deriving of stories for blog derived from forum activity, and the actual needs of developers.

buildingblocks.name: Product Hunt
buildingblocks.summary: Product Hunt is a place to share the latest tech creations, providing an excellent format for API providers to share details about their new API offerings.
buildingblocks.details: Product Hunt is a place to share the latest tech creations, providing an excellent format for API providers to share details about their new API offerings.
